commands.!help:
Current commands include:
!install - How to play with bots
!tutorials - How to make your own bot
!lanset - How to play with bots and friends (LAN)
!wiki - Documentation
!tournaments - Upcoming bot tournaments

See <#844986187751358524> for frequently asked questions

commands.!reinstall:
1. Press `Windows + R`, type in `%localappdata%\RLBotGUIX\python37-uninstall` and then press Enter
2. Launch RLBotGUI - this will reinstall Python only.

**If that doesn't work or you don't want to preserve Python dependencies**
1. Press `Windows + R`, type in `%localappdata%\RLBotGUIX` and then press Enter
2. Double-click `python37-uninstall` (if it exists) and then delete the folder `Python37` as well as the folder `venv` (if it exists)
3. Launch RLBotGUI

commands.!loginepic: To log in to your Epic account and use your normal presets and settings, press the Steam/Epic Games button in the bottom middle of RLBotGUI, click the "Get My Items/Settings" checkbox, and click save 😊

commands.!avignorerlbot:
1. Navigate to you antivirus's quarantine
2. Go to each file that relates to RLBot and there should be an option that says something like "Restore and add exception"
3. Launch RLBotGUI (you may have to reinstall)
commands.!delstorysave: In RLBotGUI, press Ctrl+Shift+J to open up the console, and enter in this: `await eel.story_delete_save()();` and then restart the gui and try story mode again.

commands.!seer: The version of Seer you saw in Sledge's video is NOT available to the public. Seer in the botpack is an older, much worse version. The best public bot is still Nexto.

Faqs.Q: How do I play against the bots?
Faqs.A:
Follow this installation guide: <https://youtu.be/oXkbizklI2U>
It will also show you how to download the bot pack containing bots like Kamael and Botimus Prime.
RLBot only works on PC both with Epic and Steam.

Faqs.Q: Which bot is the best bot and how good is it?
Faqs.A:
The best bot is Nexto for both 1v1,  2v2, and 3v3. It is around GC rank in terms of skill and can be found in the bot pack. See Q1.

Here is a summary of other bots in the bot pack:

**God-tier bots:** Nexto
**S-tier bots:** Necto, Element
**A-tier bots:** Kamael, ReliefBot, Self-driving car, 3x Bumblebee, Botimus Prime, Redbot
**B-tier bots:** Wildfire, Codename Cryo, Diablo, Stick, St. Peter (goalie)
**C-tier bots:** Lanfear, PenguinBot, Beast from the East, VirxEB, BribbleBot, DisasterBot
**Spice things up:** AdversityBot, Sniper, Snek, Invisibot, LaserBoi
**Machine learning bots:** Nexto, Necto, Element, Levi, TensorBot

**Notes:** Self-driving car and Stick have no teamplay. Codename Cryo is best with 2 teammates.

The RLBot framework cannot be used online. The API is only activated when the game is started with a special RLBot setting which disables online play. You can be banned without warning if we suspect that you have malicious intent (farming, levelling, etc.). We want to stay on Psyonix's good side here.

Faqs.Q: Can I use RLBot with friends?
Faqs.A:
You can! It requires setting up a LAN/VLAN connection. Here is a guide: <https://github.com/RLBot/RLBot/wiki/LAN-Setup>

It is not possible to play with friends cross platform.

Faqs.Q: Are the bots using machine learning?
Faqs.A:
Most bots are hardcoded and do not use machine learning. However, since the release of RLGym the machine learning bot are progressing faster than ever. If you are interested in making a ML bot yourself, start by reading the ML FAQ: <https://github.com/RLBot/RLBot/wiki/Machine-Learning-FAQ>.

Check out RLGym here: <https://rlgym.github.io/>

Some ML projects to check out are:
- Necto: Community trained 1v1, 2v2, and 3v3 generic play using reinforcement learning
- Element: 1v1 generic play using reinforcement learning
- Levi: Supervised learning on the bot Stick
- TensorBot: Supervised learning on the bot Diablo
- Eagle: Air dribbling using reinforcement learning

Faqs.Q: How do I get started making my own bot?
Faqs.A:
Decide which language to use. RLBot supports <:python:601513253415288834> Python (most used), <:java:601511526167216129> Java, <:scratchcat:444921286703972352> Scratch, <:csharp:601512444396961796> C#, <:ferris:651069080278925312> Rust, <:cpp:601512590593490955> C++, <:js:601514078657183767> JavaScript, and <:golang:869121045792170046> Go. We recommend having some amount of experience with programming before making a bot. However, making a bot can be a great way to get more comfortable with programming or a specific language.

You can find example bots in each language on <http://www.rlbot.org/> showing off the basics and various features. We also have a few tutorials:
- GoslingUtils (Python): <https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PL2MGDOTjPtl8fuoXmqxTmASW1ZtrPEXQ2>
- VirxERLU (Python): <https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLeo0zkmzSE-UUFV-bd2vWtqiqe2cjaQNf>
- RedUtils (C#): <https://youtu.be/zlXnX7snky8>
- Java: <https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL0Chr9HhL2DQijgJ4b4ho4pBpxFfHXP0m>
- Dodges (C#): <https://tangil.me/posts/dodges>
- State systems (C#): <https://tangil.me/posts/state>
- RLBotTraining: <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uGFmOZCpel8&list=PL6LKXu1RlPdxh9vxmG1y2sghQwK47_gCH>

Addition resources, documentation, and examples can be found on the RLBot wiki at <https://github.com/RLBot/RLBot/wiki>. Feel free to ask for help in the appropriate language channel or in strategy or mathematics.

Faqs.Q: What is in the GameTickPacket and FieldInfo?
Faqs.A:
The GameTickPacket is a packet sent to your bot each tick. It contains information about everything that tends to update during the game. For instance, the location and velocity of all cars and the ball, the state of boost pads, the time elapsed.

The FieldInfo contains information that is static throughout the game. For instance, the location and size of boost pads and the location of goals.

More information about the GameTickPacket, FieldInfo, and even the ControllerState can be found at <https://github.com/RLBot/RLBotPythonExample/wiki/Input-and-Output-Data>.

Faqs.Q: What are the dimensions of the field? Gravity? Ball radius? Max speed? Boost? Kickoff locations? etc?
Faqs.A:
Visit the RLBot wiki to find this information: <https://github.com/RLBot/RLBot/wiki/Useful-Game-Values>.
To learn more about the physics of Rocket League, see chip's notes: <https://samuelpmish.github.io/notes/RocketLeague/>
A note on jumping physics: <https://github.com/RLBot/RLBot/wiki/Jumping-Physics>
<https://i.imgur.com/nOz84cD.png>

RLBot uses an API in Rocket League specifically made for us. This API is activated when the game is launched with the `-rlbot` flag, which simultaneously disables all online play. The RLBotCore dll communicates with the game through this API and this is where most of the magic happens. Communication with bots are done through sockets (shared memory in the past) which allow us to support a wide range of languages.

Faqs.Q: How do I use debug rendering/game state setting/ball prediction/RLBotTraining?
Faqs.A:
The RLBot framework comes with a set of useful features. Learn more about these here:
- Debug rendering: <https://github.com/RLBot/RLBot/wiki/Rendering>
- Game state setting/manipulation: <https://github.com/RLBot/RLBot/wiki/Manipulating-Game-State>
- Ball prediction: <https://github.com/RLBot/RLBot/wiki/Ball-Path-Prediction>
- Quick chat: <https://github.com/RLBot/RLBotPythonExample/wiki/Quickchat>
- RLBotTraining: <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uGFmOZCpel8&list=PL6LKXu1RlPdxh9vxmG1y2sghQwK47_gCH>
